meanings.definition: A person who measures and sells grain in bushels.
meanings.sent1: The bushellers at the market carefully weighed the grain in bushels.
meanings.sent2: The local farmers formed a cooperative of bushellers to sell their crops.
meanings.sent3: The bushellers decided to have a bushel-measuring contest for fun.
meanings.sent4: The bushellers were like diligent bees, buzzing around the bushels of grain.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bushellers meticulously counting bushels stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: A group of people who work together to measure and sell grain in bushels.
meanings.sent1: The bushellers in the warehouse efficiently sorted and packaged the grain.
meanings.sent2: The annual fair had a bustling market with many bushellers selling their goods.
meanings.sent3: The bushellers held a bushel-themed party to celebrate their successful harvest.
meanings.sent4: The bushellers were a well-oiled machine, smoothly handling the bushels of grain.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the bushellers working in harmony was a testament to their teamwork.
